_comment: Created by ianb on 20/03/2015 10:57:44 using v2.5
title: How do admissions for falls vary by age?
analysis_commentary: In 2012/13 the rate of hospital admission for falls decreased with age for both genders until people aged 30-34, with males having more admissions than females. From this point on rates of admission begin to increase slowly until people reach 60-64, then rates increase more steeply in females. Beyond the age of 60 rates of admission increase sharply, with rates of admission for females reaching nearly double that for males.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Hospital Episode Statistics (Copyright 2013, Re-used with the permission of the Health & Social Care Information Centre. All rights reserved)
